name: Chip
slogan: our mission to build the best savings account in the world
description:
At Chip, we save you money by moving small amounts from your bank account into a savings account. That’s it. Simple, but not sexy. We’ll also look after your overdraft, and saving you from those dreaded bank charges. That’s simple too, but still not sexy. Thankfully, it’s really effective, and a huge number of our users have also become our investors. 

What’s simple for the user though, is incredibly complex behind the scenes. Which is why we’re doubling our engineering team. With that comes some new processes, as we strive to improve our workflow and communication across the organisation. It genuinely is a great time to join a Fintech company at the forefront of the Open Banking revolution.

jobs.title: Senior Back End Engineer
jobs.description:
TL;DR:

PHP // MVC Framework // MongoDB // AWS // Jenkins // Docker
No table tennis.
Fintech startup
Language-agnostic

At Chip, we save you money by moving small amounts from your bank account into a savings account. That’s it. Simple, but not sexy. We’ll also look after your overdraft, and saving you from those dreaded bank charges. That’s simple too, but still not sexy. Thankfully, it’s really effective, and a huge number of our users have also become our investors.

What’s simple for the user though, is incredibly complex behind the scenes. Which is why we’re scaling our engineering team where we need focused, talented and dedicated software engineers to help us build out a world beating feature set. Joining our engineering team and you’ll be responsible for developing new features and services to help us continue to deliver a great product to our customers that helps our company and their money grow.

It genuinely is a great time to join a Fintech company at the forefront of the Open Banking revolution.

Working on our backend stack (PHP, MongoDB) you’ll help write the code behind our entire suite of REST API’s that powers our Android and iOS applications, as well as some amazing in house tools that help us manage all our internal processes.

 
What you'll do  

Write good, clean, documented, testable code.

Evaluate technical requirements for new features and improvements

We’re looking for Developer's of all skill levels, so if some of the requirements in the list below don’t seem quite right. Get in touch anyway, we love clever, driven people who are keen to learn.

 
What we’re really looking for

Proven work experience as a Software Engineer or Software Developer

Ability to develop software in PHP

An understanding of NoSQL databases, ideally MongoDB.

Experience developing modern web applications using at least one popular web framework (Phalcon, Symfony, Laravel, CakePHP, Zend, Yii or other)

Experience with test-driven development

Some proficiency with modern PHP tooling (composer, xdebug, phpunit, phpcs, phpmd, psalm etc...)

Ability to document requirements and specifications
 

Perks 

Market leading salary

Share option scheme. We recently secured £4m in Series A funding valuing the company at over £18m. All the team have share options in the company as we work together to achieve great results for the company.

5% interest bonus on all Chip savings

Brand New MacBook Pro, or equivalent.

Workplace pension scheme

Flexible working arrangements

Unlimited holiday (28 days contracted + bank holidays + Xmas to New year but policy not to count) ✈️

Free Classpass membership

Based in the heart of Shoreditch, Brick lane and Spitalfields

Monthly team lunches in a thriving food scene

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.description:
At Chip, we save you money by moving small amounts from your bank account into a savings account. That’s it. Simple, but not sexy. We’ll also look after your overdraft, and saving you from those dreaded bank charges. That’s simple too, but still not sexy. Thankfully, it’s really effective, and a huge number of our users have also become our investors.

What’s simple for the user though, is incredibly complex behind the scenes. Which is why we’re scaling our engineering team where we need focused, talented and dedicated DevOps Engineers to help us build out a world beating feature set.

As our engineers work on breaking down a monolithic code base into microservices to ensure we can scale both our teams and our application we need an infrastructure to support that scale and we require a DevOps engineer to help us achieve it. Working closely with our Head of DevOps and our VP of Engineering you'll be responsible for putting our new microservices into staging/production and orchestrating a world class architecture to support them and their continuous deployment. You'll also be responsible for maintaining the stability of our monolithic architecture and finding and implementing improvements as needed.

We believe infrastructure should be in code and are looking for an engineer who can help transition all of our infrastructure into a more programmatic and scaleable solution, using the likes of AWS CloudFormation/Ansible/Terraform/Chef/Puppet/Bash as well as Kubernetes and Docker, and CI platforms like Jenkins and DroneCI (These are only example and you'll have a real chance to set the direction of our DevOps procedures and the tools we use)

What we’re really looking for

Good knowledge of AWS services.
Good knowledge of an orchestration tools like CloudFormation, Ansible, Teraform, Chef, Puppet or others.
Good knowledge of at least one programming language like Go, Python, Perl, PHP.
Good knowledge of containerisation, specifically Docker (and Kubernetes)
Good knowledge of monitoring solutions such as NewRelic and Prometheus as well as dashboard tools such as Grafana.
Good knowledge of CI/CD tools like Jenkins, TeamCity, DroneCI, GitLab CI or others.
Some knowledge of NoSQL databases like Mongo or DocumentDB.
Some knowledge of SQL databases like Postgres.
Some knowledge of other cloud providers, like GCP or DigitalOcean.
Experience with Distributed Systems: Scaling, Fault-Tolerance, Load-Balancing, Networking, Security.

Perks

Competitive Salary
Unlimited holiday
Brand new MacBook Pro (or similar)
Yearly conference budget
5% interest rate on savings held at Chip
Monthly team events/outings
Relaxed working environment

jobs.title: Brand Designer
jobs.description:
We’re Chip, we’re building the world’s best savings account.

We’re using cutting edge tech and AI to shake up the slow, stagnant and old-fashioned savings market. 

We’ve built a clever app that makes saving easier, faster, and smarter. It makes your financial goals happen automatically, and gets you feeling good about your money.

We’re growing fast, and we have some very exciting plans. So we need a Graphic Designer to help us make them happen. 

The Role -  Graphic Designer

We need a Graphic Designer with a passion to create work which is visually appealing who will use their skills in graphic/brand design to develop and optimise all our creative content whether that be through the UI/UX of a product or through a Visual identity. You’ll have a keen eye for design, video, copy and a mega-brain of ideas, specifically for creating content to hook new users, and you’ll be confident in bringing your own ideas to the table and then to life.


What you’ll be doing:

You’ll be working within the marketing team and key stakeholders;


Storyboarding, producing and delivering video animation content for all our channels
Owning and delivering all campaign assets (video, canvas, stills)
Collaborating with team members to understand what motivates and excites our users, and then putting it into practice
Creating custom and responsive digital assets (newsletters, microsites, web ads and digital banners)
Finding new and imaginative ways to reach our target audience
Creating and building online campaigns for various platforms
Ensuring campaign look and feel is consistent with other touchpoints of the chip brand
Helping us build the best savings account in the world, by being a user yourself and sharing your ideas to improve our app.
You should apply if:

Experience in designing digital acquisition creative
Solid understanding of all Google and Facebook’s platforms and ad formats
Extensive experience with:
Adobe After Effects/animation/motion design
Adobe Photoshop/Illustrator/Sketch
Adobe Premiere Pro/video editing
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Typography and layout skills
Perks 

£25,000 - £35,000pa

Share option scheme. We recently secured £4m in Series A funding valuing the company at over £18m. All the team have share options in the company as we work together to achieve great results for the company.

5% interest bonus on all Chip savings

Brand New MacBook Pro, or equivalent.

Workplace pension scheme

Flexible working arrangements

Unlimited holiday (28 days contracted + bank holidays + Xmas to New year but policy not to count) ✈️

Free Classpass membership

Based in the heart of Shoreditch, Brick lane and Spitalfields

Monthly team lunches in a thriving food scene

jobs.title: Insight Analyst
jobs.description:
We’re Chip, we’re building the world’s best savings account.

We’re using cutting edge tech and AI to shake up the slow, stagnant and old-fashioned savings market. 

We’ve built a clever app that makes saving easier, faster, and smarter. It makes your financial goals happen automatically, and gets you feeling good about your money.

We’re growing fast, and we have some very exciting plans. So we need an Insight Analyst to help us make them happen. 

The Role - Insight Analyst

You’ll be at the intersection between Data and Strategy - deep diving into our data and generating insights, across the entire organisation. Collaborating with the strategic team to ensure we make data driven decisions.

As an Insight Analyst, you will:

You will be a key part of producing customer insights for the company

Work on customer segmentation, profiling, clustering and customer journey projects

You will get exposure to and work on statistical projects with Python and SQL

You will use Python and SQL to code and query the database in order to derive insights for the company

You will work on customer retention and acquisition strategies

You will be a part of advanced analytics work too e.g. modelling and personalisation

As an Insight Analyst, you will:

2:1 or above (or equivalent) from a leading university within a quantitative subjects (Mathematics, Engineering, Sciences)

Confident getting hands-on with Python to process data and automate processes

Good understanding of reporting and data modelling best practices

Good written and verbal communication skills and an ability to translate problems into technical requirements and implement a solution.

Work within the Data Science team reporting to the Head of Data Science

Perks 

£30,000 - £50,000pa

Share option scheme. We recently secured £4m in Series A funding valuing the company at over £18m. All the team have share options in the company as we work together to achieve great results for the company.

5% interest bonus on all Chip savings

Brand New MacBook Pro, or equivalent.

Workplace pension scheme

Flexible working arrangements

Unlimited holiday (28 days contracted + bank holidays + Xmas to New year but policy not to count) ✈️

Free Classpass membership

Based in the heart of Shoreditch, Brick lane and Spitalfields

Monthly team lunches in a thriving food scene
